sentence.text: ï»¿A 31-year-old Japanese woman (I-1) and her partner (I-2) were referred to the Department of Obstetrics of Hokkaido University Hospital with a neonate at 12 weeks of gestation with fetal hydrops (II-2) (Figure 1b).
Fetal ultrasonography revealed severe cystic hygroma and severe micromelia (Figure 2e,f).
At 16 weeks of gestation, intrauterine fetal death was confirmed by ultrasound examination.
The skeletal phenotype in autopsy imaging was typical for that of ACG1B (Figure 2g).
Following genetic counseling, the couple agreed to undergo targeted sequencing of genes associated with ACG1B.
